clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: DAS28-ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation and lack of blinding of outcome assessors of non-radiographic outcomes in the study with the higher weight

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population who are non-MTX csDMARD naive.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Disability (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation and lack of blinding of outcome assessors of non-radiographic outcomes in the study with the higher weight

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population who are non-MTX csDMARD naive.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Pain (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: VAS 0-100 (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -11.9)

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population who are non-MTX csDMARD naive.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population who are non-MTX csDMARD naive.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Very small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Withdrawal due to lack of efficacy (follow up: 1 year)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation and lack of blinding of outcome assessors of non-radiographic outcomes in the study with the higher weight

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population who are non-MTX csDMARD naive.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size and low number of events.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Withdrawal due to adverse events (follow up: 1 year)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation and lack of blinding of outcome assessors of non-radiographic outcomes in the study with the higher weight

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population who are non-MTX csDMARD naive.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
